citations.narrative:
On the evening of October 25, 2024 an adult female beagle (#1691T) was inadvertently locked out from its water source
overnight. A facility veterinarian immediately assessed the dog the following morning to confirm there were no serious
health concerns as a result of the incident. The dog was found bright, alert, active and drank moderately when offered
water. The veterinarian found mild signs of dehydration but no signs of illness or injury, and the dog received
subcutaneous fluids. An investigation by facility staff revealed the door between the two sides of the kennel was not
functioning properly and may have caused the dog to be locked out. The door was repaired and functioning properly at
the time of inspection.
Failure to provide continual access to water can result in discomfort and serious dehydration. The facility must ensure that
potable water is made continuously available to all dogs, unless excepted by the attending veterinarian or excepted as
provided under section 3.17(a).
CORRECTED BEFORE THE TIME OF THIS INSPECTION CONDUCTED ON 12/03/2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
